item.title: Tim Walz Celebrating Tesla’s Falling Stock Price Raises Deeper Questions About State Pensions
item.description: Walz is chairman of Minnesota’s state investment board, but he seems worryingly clueless about how funds are invested.

item.title: Social Media Is Killing the Democratic Party
item.description: The online crowd may love the antics of influencers. But swing voters? Not so much.

item.title: Why Trump Should Not Fight the Courts
item.description: The administration can turn the tables on the left.

item.title: Gaudí on the Sainthood Track, and Hunter Biden as a Starving Artist
item.description: Plus, in the news, two new museum directors and an art slasher who overly likes her sausages

item.title: Abrego Garcia Not Part of El Salvador’s Agreement to Detain TdA Gang Members
item.description: The administration thus contends that it is not in violation of the Supreme Court’s April 7 decision.
